Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom.synopsis: Small crime dialogue with Spike if he sees you kill Liam.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom.synopsis: Grush gets mad at the player for attacking or killing the tortured adventurer.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: In the provided sessions, we can identify that 'Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom' is triggered by an action of killing, which implies that it is a direct consequence of a prior action. This suggests that there is a sequential relationship where the murder must happen before the dialogue with Spike can occur. Additionally, 'Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom' indicates a reaction to an attack or killing, which means it also has a dependency on a preceding action. Since both 'Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom' and 'Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom' relate to violent actions, they cannot occur simultaneously, as they both refer to the aftermath of different violent events involving the same character (Spike). Thus, they are mutually exclusive as they cannot both reflect different outcomes from the same scenario.

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_1.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_1.text: |I still have info to exctract from prisoner. Don't do anything funny!|

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_2.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_2.text: |I still haven't have enough fun with him. No touchy!|

Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_3.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_AssaultCustom_3.text: |I uhh... Would like to have prisoner alive... If it's okay with you?|

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_1.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_1.text: No! I wanted him to suffer! N-not that you killed him too easily, your drowness. I meant no offence.
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_1.context: NodeContext: He says the 'no! I wanted him to suffer!' on instinct, then realises he's talking to a drow and scrambles to correct himself and show enough reverence.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_2.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_2.text: He can't be dead! I never got any answers out of him!
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_2.context: InternalNodeContext: Goblins don't know where the den is.NodeContext: Spike is extremely worried. The palyer killed the prisoner he had to extract information from, and he's certain his commander will kill him for his failure.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_0.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_0.text: She'll kill me. This is it. This is the end... but oh, I'll make you pay before I die.
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_0.context: NodeContext: Fiercely angry - about to attack the player.

Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_3.speaker: Torturer Spike
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_3.text: No! I still had more to do with him! Guess I'll have to give his due to you, eh?
Torturers_Spike_MurderCustom_3.context: NodeContext: sadistic - he couldn't exact revenge on the prisoner, so the player will have to pay instead. Starts combat.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_1.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_1.text: I said he's MINE. Now YOU are, too.
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_1.context: NodeContext: H's mad and petulant because the playerkept attacking the tortured adventurer, who he considers to be his.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_2.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_2.text: NO! He was MINE! Mine to kill!

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_0.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_0.text: I'll cut you for this. Cut you to pieces and mix all your meat. And then I will FEAST.

Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_3.speaker: Lookout Grush
Torturers_Goblet_AssaultCustom_3.text: NO! He's MINE. Mine to cut, mine to eat. Spike PROMISED.
